intro: Ortholoma anisophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
